remarks:
Theorem for alternate representation of ordered pairs, requiring the Axiom of Regularity ~ ax-reg (via the ~ preleq step).  See ~ df-op for a description of other ordered pair representations.  Exercise 34 of [Enderton] p. 207.  (Contributed by NM, 16-Oct-1996.) 

---

 Theorem for alternate representation of ordered pairs, requiring the Axiom of Set Induction ~ ax-setind (via the ~ preleq step).  See ~ df-op for a description of other ordered pair representations.  Exercise 34 of [Enderton] p. 207.  (Contributed by NM, 16-Oct-1996.)
statement:
preleq.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
preleq.2 $e |- B e. _V $.
preleq.3 $e |- C e. _V $.
preleq.4 $e |- D e. _V $.
opthreg $p |- ( { A , { A , B } } = { C , { C , D } } <-> ( A = C /\ B = D ) ) $.
